# Celestial cartographers of the soul
## Scripture
"For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do." - Ephesians 2:10

## Reflection
As we gaze up at the starry night sky, we are reminded of the celestial cartographers who have spent centuries mapping the heavens. Just as they have meticulously charted the movements of planets and stars, God has meticulously planned our lives, preparing good works for us to do. The winter season, with its darker nights, can be a time of introspection and self-reflection. It's a time to consider the map of our own souls, to explore the depths of our hearts and discern the path God has laid out for us. The constellations above, once used for navigation, now serve as a reminder of God's guidance in our lives.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, thank you for creating us with purpose and intention. Help us to navigate the twists and turns of life, to follow the path you have prepared for us. Give us wisdom to discern your will and courage to follow it, even in the darkest of times. May the beauty of the night sky remind us of your infinite love and guidance, and may we shine like stars in the darkness, reflecting your light to a world in need. Amen.
